es.eucm.eadandroid.common.gui
Class TC

java.lang.Object
  es.eucm.eadandroid.common.gui.TC

public class TC
extends Object

This class holds all the methods to load and handle the text strings to the rest of the application.

Author:
Bruno Torijano Bueno

appendStrings

public static void appendStrings(String languageFile)
Loads the language file specified as argument but does not clear the properties structure, appending both contents. The results are equivalent to: properties = properties.append(propertiesFromNewFile)

appendStrings

public static void appendStrings(InputStream languageFile)
Loads the language file specified as argument but does not clear the properties structure, appending both contents. The results are equivalent to: properties = properties.append(propertiesFromNewFile)

containsText

public static boolean containsText(String tag)
Returns true if the string associated with the given identifier is on the language file.

Parameters:
tag - String identifier
Returns:
true if found, false otherwise

containsConditionsContextText

public static boolean containsConditionsContextText(int element,
                                                    int sentence)
Returns true if the string associated with the given identifier is on the language file.

Parameters:
tag - String identifier
sentence - 1 for normal sentence, 2 for no-condition sentence
Returns:
true if found, false otherwise

Parameters:

Returns:

                                              int sentence)

get

public static String get(String identifier)
Returns the string associated with the given identifier.

Parameters:
identifier - Identifier to search for the string
Returns:
String retrieved from the text base, "Error" if the text was not found

get

public static String get(String identifier,
                         String parameter)
Returns the string associated with the given identifier. This method also replaces occurrences in the original string with words passed through the call. Every placeholder for the strings have all the form "#n", where n is the index of the string to replace the placeholder in the given array. This method takes only one string to replace.

Parameters:
identifier - Identifier to search for the string
parameter - String to replace the placeholder in the returned string
Returns:
String retrieved from the text base, "Error" if the text was not found

get

public static String get(String identifier,
                         String[] parameters)
Returns the string associated with the given identifier. This method also replaces occurrences in the original string with words passed through the call. Every placeholder for the strings have all the form "#n", where n is the index of the string to replace the placeholder in the given array. This method takes an array of strings to replace.

Parameters:
identifier - Identifier to search for the string
parameters - Array of strings to replace the placeholders in the returned string
Returns:
String retrieved from the text base, "Error" if the text was not found

getToolName

public static String getToolName(Class c)
Returns the default name of the edition tool given its class

Parameters:
c - The class of the tool
Returns:
The the text if any, "Error" if not found
